Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Froogles Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a very desirable area of Paris. Standard room excellent, clean and the staff very polite. Would stay again. In the heart of all the big fashion houses only downside the restaurants in the immediate area very expensive however 10mins on the Metro to the Latin Quarter there is a great choice of restaurants with very reasonable priced menus.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay with 1yr old”
Reviews.Author: jormn
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, friendly staff who are very helpful with young children. Lovely breakfast and good restaurant recommendations. Booked a suite which was really big and beautifully furnished.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ALH66
Reviews.Content: Having had two nights in this hotel I felt that I had to recommend it to others. It is an absolute gem of a place just a few 100 yards from designer heaven and perfect location for getting around. We stayed in a suite as we had our daughter with us and it was spacious. Breakfast included which was excellent. The service was friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could keep it secret!”
Reviews.Author: Mjamous
Reviews.Content: I've been going there for years now and i'm always returning with a big smile. Rooms are very nice and clean. Breakfast is included. The hotel is located in a very quiet street. Another thing that is very important is location, location, location! Few steps from Avenue Montaigne, The designer street of Paris, few steps of Champs Elysees, 15 minutes from the Eiffel Tower, direct subway to Printemps, Galerie Lafayettes, 4 stops only! Many nice and In restaurants in the neighborhood like L’Avenue on avenue Montaigne, La Duree on Champs Elysees.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned and beautiful French style hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Timo V
Reviews.Content: Small, comfortable and beautiful French style hotel in the heart of Paris. Everything is functioning. Charming rooms, good service. Recommended both for business travellers as well as for tourists. Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel.......”
Reviews.Author: lostnyctraveler
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again in a heartbeat! So parisian, in every sense of the word. It's charming and quaint and the service is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Very good, elegant hotel and perfect location !”
Reviews.Author: Johan W
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard room which we both loved a lot ! Very nice interior design, good size, marble bathroom, very quiet and very good bed. The location is also one of the best so we will be back for sure !

Reviews.Title: “A nice small boutique hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: MiniLisa521
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 6 day honeymoon in Paris and I can't say enough about it. First of all the location was perfect with a 15 minute walk form the Eiffel Tower and just minutes from a mid point on the Champs Elysees. It was just the traditional type of Parisian hotel experience I was looking for. The decor was pretty and tasteful. The bed was a queen size, which we like and very comfortable. The room was not very large but certainly not tight even by American standards. The bathroom was beautiful and the shower was fantastic! There was a deep tub that was a welcome relaxation after walking all over the city for sightseeing. I thought that the continental breakfast was perfect, with a large selection of bread, pastries, yogurts and cereals, coffee, tea and juice, so that I could have something different everyday and they would deliver it to your room if you preferred. You could also order eggs and such which I think was included but I never did because everything else was so good. And I can't say enough about the reception staff who seemed to work very long hours but each one was so friendly and helpful. I truly enjoyed staying here and would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a family of four”
Reviews.Author: Patricia A
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a quad room with our 2 kids (7 yr old). It was decent space for four in a city. It was also a very good location...close to Champs Elysees but not on the main strip. Breakfast was included...your basics...toast, muffin, juice, fruit, coffee, yogurt. Staff was very friendly. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: melwood
Reviews.Content: The location was everything for us for the things we planned to do: A five minute walk to the Battoux Mouche dinner river boat embarkation point. A five minute walk to Arc di Triumphe A five minute walk to the Champs Elysees A 100 yard walk to the best steak & chips restaurant we've ever been in. Elegant extremely quiet one way street, but just yards from the action. We stayed in a front room with a semblance of a balcony on the 2nd floor (or third if you're North American). Rooms are so chintsy if you like that style, but very well maintained and room was very quiet. I'd give the place 5 stars, but the breakfast area is too small and we got screwed by a taxi driver going back to the airport and somebody in Paris needs to pay! TIP Have lunch, not dinner at Jules Verne on the 2nd level of the Eiffel Tower, saves you a fortune, but oh so worth doing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Rimma B
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at the hotel in the middle of October 2011. Since it's our first time in Paris, we weren't sure about the exact location, although the description on other reviews said it's in close proximity to everything. We've received a desired room, that was requested before our arrival. The check in process was smooth, way before the official check in time. The reception personal was very helpful, courteous, pleasant. All spoke English. We stayed at the standard room. Even though we had some doubts about the size of the room, and first considered to stay in deluxe room, we weren;t dissapointment with our choice of the room. The room had separate bathroom and toilet. There was a bath tub in the bathroom, towels heater. The room had a balcony facing the city, small sitting area, minibar and kettle. Wi Fi connection was pretty good. The breakfast was decent and was served in a cozy dinning room. There was an option to order extra food for breakfast for extra pay. The location of the hotel is excellent. In close walking distance from Champs Elysees, and other major attractions. We used the public transit only to get to destination out of town. There are different Metro and RER station in close proximity to the hotel. Overall, we were very happy with our stay at this hotel and will stay there again in our future visits. We will definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet street, terrific location”
Reviews.Author: madagee
Reviews.Content: It was awesome to be this close to all the major attractions in a small very nice hotel. The rooms were clean. The staff pleasant. They recommended an Italian restaurant down the street. We went there twice. Just a really nice place for our family in the heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kayra61
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Chambiges Elysees Hotel was magnificent. The place of the hotel is very close to Champ Elysees, av. George V and Eiffel Tower and also it is close to a metro station. I would you like send my best wishes to hotel manager and reception desk. Their free upgrade to Deluxe room was a very kind gesture. Inside the hotel, our room had a street view. Maybe it is not looking to av. Montaigne but it looks to a bar which looks very attractive place but sometimes it could be noisy. Because it is a boutique hotel, the coridors were a bit like maze but finally you reach up to our French-style decorated room which is charming.Also the breakfast are was small but nicely decorated. Although the breakfast was free of charge, the quality and number of foods were really satisfactory. I am really looking forward to stay at Chambiges Elysees again and I thank them for increasing our pleasure of visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Chambiges Elysees”
Reviews.Author: JamesB1947
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Chambiges Elysees for a week in early September 2011 and were very happy with our choice. The CE is a small hotel located on a quiet street between the Champs Elysees and the River Seine, 5 minutes walk to both. The rooms are all quiet, very clean and beautifully decorated. The CE provides an excellent continental breakfast. The hotel staff are all friendly, polite and very helpful. We would definitely stay there again. JB

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel in the Golden Triangle”
Reviews.Author: 7226sw
Reviews.Content: The hotel, its breakfast and staff were all delightful. Hotel location in Paris depends on what you want to do. We wanted proximity to the Champs Ã‰lysÃ©es, without a killer price, so the Chambiges was perfect. It is within a reasonable walk to metro, but closer would have been nice. The Wi-Fi was inconsistent and slow.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Area. Stayed here each year for 10 years!”
Reviews.Author: standinTORONTO
Reviews.Content: Likecoming home... free breakfast, comfortable bed and always clean! Bathroom is spotless and TV channels have plenty of choices.There is a mini supermarket around the corner to the north west. A few minutes (8 to 10minutes there'sis a full grocery store (basement) on the east side of Champs Elysees. The fashion district has spread to be all around this location. It is the Golden Triangle of Paris. Staff is 5 star.... very helpful. Great Restaurants in every direction nearby! Metro at Champ Elysees (5 - 8 minutes). 20 minute walk to the Louvre (southeast) or Eiffel Tower (south west). Quiet neighborhood and a quiet hotel... its easy to sleep here. Outdoor patio, bar sitting area off the lobby. It is a boutique hotel that I honestly hope nobody else finds because the price is great and we get a room up grade offered if its available... The only reason its not a 5 star is probably because it is a small hotel and the window veiw is limited to a street view or a small courtyard. But hey.... who stays in their room in Paris???

Reviews.Title: “It was very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Igor I
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel with my family during 1 week in August 2009. It was very good experience. It is really small luxury hotel. We have very comfortable and well decorated room for 4 persons. Our charming room was very clean. This hotel has very convenient location near the Avenue des Champs ElysÃ©es. Breakfast was excellent for small European hotel. It was not big but very tasty. You will find in this hotel very good service and amicable staff. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. All spoke English. I highly recommend this hotel and exactly will stay there in future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel--a little pricey but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Siriaca
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and accommodating. All spoke English. The hotel is very close to two metro stations and a short walk to the Eiffel Tower and the Champs Ã‰lysÃ©es. It is in a beautiful area full of high-end boutiques. Lots of fun seeing all the rare luxury cars. The hotel itself is small and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we've stayed in in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Timeplace
Reviews.Content: The staff are the most helpful and accommodating people we've met. Hotel rooms are amazing, and the proximity to the main attractions and to great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: Sarah959
Reviews.Content: Good location, good service, very clean and good value for money. The desk staff were very friendly and spoke very clear English. The breakfast was a typical European breakfast, so don't expect a fry-up but there's plenty of fresh food. The decor was absolutely beautiful and gave the hotel a very French boutique feel. I was travelling with my parents and my father was sick in bed for two out of the four days we were there; the staff were very understanding and helpful. Plus with the location, on the day he was well, he was able to see the Eiffel Tower and Arch D'Triomphe, due to the close proximity. There's also a great restaurant two minutes walk away by called Chez Andre, which do fantastic French food at a very reasonable price and spoke English. I've stayed in central Paris four times before this and I would definitely stay here again above any other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “old world charm in great location”
Reviews.Author: lynnforever29
Reviews.Content: We were pleased to find an affordable suite on the top floor of this boutique hotel for our family of 4 and stayed 3 nights. There are no amazing views, but it is in a lovely neighborhood a short walk from the Arc du Triomphe, River Seine, and the Eiffel Tower. A taxi stand is just around the corner in front of the gorgeous Plaza Athenae. The hotel staff spoke English very well and were exceedingly helpful. The included breakfast is wonderful. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: pennboss
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to be close to both the Arc de Triomphe, Notre Dame and the Eiffel Tower, then this is the place. Location is excellent, on a very quiet block in the 8th Arrondisement, with several nice restaurants within walking distance. Location is key in Paris, and this location is tops. Metro is nearby, and within a short distance, you can walk over to the Arc. Hotel staff is very friendly and accomodating, English is not a problem, and the continental breakfast is excellent. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Chambiges Elysees....I miss you!”
Reviews.Author: CathRun
Reviews.Content: What a lovely boutique hotel! Very quiet, very quaint. The hotel is clean, beautifully decorated, and not a far walk to the Eiffel Tower. I have to give them five stars because of their sweet staff. Such lovely, helpful people. I came down with a horrible cold on my last day in Paris. What a drag. But the manager, who is a beautiful, bright woman whose name I can't recall, made sure I had a cup of tea and even checked on me in my room after my husband and daughter had left to go sightseeing. What a wonderful place. Breakfast every morning was fresh and plentiful...really and truly this hotel helped make our second stay in Paris memorable and delightful. Once again I left amazed by the warmth and kindness of the French people.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel like a sweet home? Yes!”
Reviews.Author: marine7389
Reviews.Content: Warm and hospitable atmosphere created by frendly staff of personell gives real feeling that you are in sweet home! Great location, luxury room interior, reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: krissie36
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The location couldn't be beat, as it was a short walk to the Champs D'ElysÃ©es, the Seine, metro stops and many restaurants. I would definitely stay here again. The breakfast was a nice mix of French (baguettes, cheese) and North American continental (yogurt, cereal, etc). It was also very nice to have ground coffee instead of espresso in the morning. The tea room was quiet and never crowded. Having free wifi was a huge bonus. I had some difficulties logging on at first, but after a new access code, everything seemed to work fine. I was very happy to be able to chat with my family back home from the comfort of my hotel room. The service was good. After having read many reviews before my trip, I was expecting exceptional service, and it was just good. The front desk staff seemed to be appreciative that I spoke in French, although I did hear them speaking very good English to other guests. One front desk clerk came up to my room to help me figure out the television; the problem ended up being that the remote wasn't working properly, so he came up because the instructions he was giving over the phone weren't working. While he was helpful, he seemed slightly irritated to be called away from his post. There was also a false fire alarm during my stay, and I had to translate for some confused guests in the lobby as to what was going on since the front desk clerk was otherwise occupied. A few things to note: 1) the hallway lights seem to be on motion sensors, so it can be dark when you get out of the elevator. I think this was a great idea, but I could see how it could be disconcerting if you weren't aware of it at first. 2) The toilet was separate from the sink/bathtub area. Everytime I used the washroom, I would have to go around to the bathroom so I could wash my hands. Seems it would make more sense to have a sink in with the toilet if you're going to separate them. Makes you wonder how many people are washing their hands! All in all, a lovely hotel, comfortable rooms, a few nice amentiies, and an amazing location!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: thomasmorrison
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the HÃ´tel Chambiges Ã‰lysÃ©es. The breakfasts were great. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great breakfast, great service!”
Reviews.Author: MNKristen
Reviews.Content: My mom, sister, sister-in-law and I were in Paris for five days to celebrate my 40th birthday. The hotel was great - perfectly located. We were close to two metro stops, and only had to cross the pont d'alma to catch the train to Versailles. The breakfast was great and the breakfast room never felt crowded. We would eat breakfast between 8-9am, so I'm not sure if it gets crowded later. The staff was very helpful and made dinner reservations for us for three of the nights we were there. On our first day, we asked if we could drink a bottle of wine we bought in the courtyard and the response was "Of course!" They gave us a bottle of opener along with several glasses. My mom had brought a travel steamer that didn't work, so she put it in the trash in the room. When we came back to the hotel that evening, they kept the steamer and asked if we had meant to throw it out. I thought it was a sign of good service that they would check with us. We had a suite, which was really just a bedroom and a sitting area (with a fold-out couch) which was adequate for us. Rooms are smaller in Europe than the U.S. and I suspect most travelers already know this. There were many restaurants right near the hotel which was nice after a day of site-seeing on foot! There is also a grocery store nearby (the hotel does not have a restaurant or room service other than breakfast). If I were to go back to Paris, I may try a hotel in a different location, but if I wanted to be in the 8th Arrondisement again, I would definitely book a room at the Hotel Chambiges! The only negative was that I had trouble using the Wifi. My sister had no problem with her iPad, but I could not get online with mine. I wondered if the Wifi has low bandwidth. Anyway, it was just fine being unplugged for a few days!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, friendly and very French!”
Reviews.Author: Megan064
Reviews.Content: This was a fabulous hotel, right in the heart of the Triangle D'Or'. The staff were excellent, nothing was a bother for them. The room was quite big and well appointed. The whole hotel had a really ''French'' feel, not a hotel in any city feel, you knew you were in Paris, although they were very quite and we got a great night's sleep every night. The breakfast was also very good, generous amounts of everything and newspapers to read, a nice relaxing way to start the day. The free wi-fi was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: tricia56
Reviews.Content: On my first trip to Paris I lucked out by staying at this hotel. Everyone was very friendly and helpful The breakfast was excellent and the location was wonderful. Would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: toddler33
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 9 day delayed honeymoon trip as we live seperately due to green card regulations here in the USA. So until we can be together in a few months we decided to take our honeymoon 3 months after our wedding in order to maintain our ongoing lifestyle of not being together more than 3 months despite living 10,000 miles apart. So naturally I chose Paris to celebrate our honeymoon in and wanted a quaint Parisian hotel with a great location, staff and still enjoy the romantic ambience that was important to us for this special time. We were certainly not disappointed by 2 of the 3, however we did have an issue with one of the staff members. I won't bore anyone with the details because despite the rude behavior from the evening clerk the Manager, Joya I believe was her name, more than made up for this with a sincere apology and a bottle of champagne and a box of La Maisson (I think) chocolates that are simply the best I have ever eaten, although my wife hid them after I had 4 or 5 so they were the best 4 or 5 chocolates I have ever eaten! We had issues with the air conditioner and the CNN channel kept going out but we were there for Paris and not for TV so small issue but anytime I mentioned anything to the remainder of the staff it was handled right away with a smile and a sense of urgency and when you stay at a high end hotel honestly this is what you should expect. This hotel is perfectly positioned between all the places you want to be so the location is great. The rooms in paris are generally small and do not expect to find workout facilities and swimming pools. The breakfast was decent but after 9 days I wanted something different of course. It seemed like they could have changed up the muffin selection or donut selection just for a few days ughhhhhhh. The price is steep, especially with the devalued dollar, but if you are travelling to Paris just enjoy it and worry about the cost later or else you will truly not experience all there is to experience. I implore you to give this place a shot if the price is right because you will not be disappointed, cheers!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: EWillis39
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in order "to do" Paris! Room was spacious with separate loo and bath/shower facilities. Decoration, though not immediately our style grew on us.,It is modern parisienne boutique chic! It provided a quiet refuge away from the tourist and traffic throngs. Breakfast good too - great choice, helpful serving staff, and as much as you could eat! Breakfast room small but that added to the charm. Location of hotel saved our tourist legs - 10 mins from Champs Elysees, 10 mins to the Seine and Bateaux Mouches also buses along the river to all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Very Special”
Reviews.Author: Texaslady88
Reviews.Content: Everything was delightful about this small hotel with beautiful decor and furnishings and an outstanding staff the got our taxis on time, etc. Loved it ant our stay there

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, perfect location, wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: flluvs2travl
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and I chose this hotel because of its location and good reviews, and because I could use miles to pay for the room. What a lovely surprise to find that this boutique hotel far surpassed our expectations! We booked a double deluxe room, which had a sitting area and was much larger than we expected given the reviews we had seen. The street was very quiet even though our room fronted it. The bed was a traditional European double, with two twins pushed together to make a king, but the mattress was fine and the linens were great. We liked that the toilet area was separated from the sink and shower/bath, and there was a makeup mirror on the wall (a little too low). The breakfast served each morning was typical continental with breads and cheeses and cereals, along with delicious pastries and coffee/tea and juice offered. With so many bistros along the streets of Paris who needs a heavy breakfast to start the day? We absolutely cannot say enough about the friendliness of the staff here, and the service we got anytime we requested anything, particularly help with directions or suggestions for restaurants or side trips. Everyone speaks perfect English along with other languages, and they were all very knowledgeable about their city. The location is easy walking distance to the Champs Elysees, Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triomphe, Place du Concorde, and Metro stops for everything else. We highly recommend this hotel and would definitely rebook here when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: alexandrosg
Reviews.Content: Amazing location, just in the centre of Paris, minutes away from Champs Elysees. Great boutique hotel, with extremely unique decor in each one of its rooms. Breakfast is really delicious and all in all I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingYorkie
Reviews.Content: I chose the Chambiges Elysees for its perfect location, being right at the heart of the 'Golden Triangle' in the 8th arrondissement. As a father travelling with 2 teenage children I wanted a hotel within walking distance of the Arc de Triomphe, Eiffel Tower and the Louvre museum. The added bonus was that its a 10 minute walk to the 'Pont de l'Alma' metro stop for a half hour's journey to Chateau de Versailles and less than 10 minutes walk to avenue des Champs Elysees. A supermarket is 200m away and the charming and quiet side streets offer a large variety of restaurants for an afternoon drink or evening meal. I wanted an archetypal Parisienne hotel with classic decor as opposed to a modern steel and concrete skyscraper and also needed a triple room and the Chambiges Elysses offered this facility. The hotel doesn't provide a restaurant service, which suits my style of travelling as I like to explore and experience local restaurants. However, a continental breakfast buffet is provided which was exemplary and even a fussy, vegetarian, teenage daughter managed to fill up with the choices offered. The staff speak fluent English although I tried my best conversational French which seemed to get me by. A taxi service to the airport was offered twice, which was thoughtful, although I had already booked return tickets on Air France's Les Cars to CDG. Service 2 runs from exit 34 at CDG's arrivals terminal 1 and terminates at the Arc de Triomphe and is only some 10 minutes walk from the hotel. The journey itself is some 45 minutes to an hour depending on traffic and costs â‚¬24 return and runs every half hour from 6am to 11pm. The Chambiges Elysees offers great value for money and I can highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “We will return to the Hotel Chambiges Elysees!”
Reviews.Author: AirBusBoatTrain
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Chambiges Elysees at the beginning of August 2010 and cannot say enough wonderful things about it. We were immediately warmly welcomed despite our inability to speak French and given our room without delay despite it being several hours before check in. When you get to your floor (there are only six, with six rooms each) the lights came on by motion sensor revealing the gorgeous woodwork that continues into the room. You leave your key in a slot inside the door to power all of the lights in the room and then simply take it out when you leave. Our room was beautiful with high ceiling crown mouldings, big floor to ceiling windows that opened into a courtyard with a garden and tables below, lovely coordinating walpaper, bed coverings, carpets and upholsteries, faux finished painted ceilings and more beautiful woodwork everywhere. Our bed was so comfortable that it was hard to get out of it. The bathroom had a large shower with great water pressure, towel warmer, shaving mirror, gorgeous stone and woodwork and private toilet area with its own door and telephone. The room also had a flat screen TV with lots of channels (at least one english speaking), a small safe, electric tea kettle, and free wifi, which is rare. As we began to explore the area we realized that the location of the hotel was equally wonderful, with the Eiffel Tower, the Champs Elysees, the Louvre and the Arc D'Triomphe all within easy walking distance. It wasn't much more of a stretch to get to Notre Dame from the Louvre either. The streets immediately surrounding the hotel have wonderful shops and restaurants with sidewalk dining, and the Rue de Chambiges itself was a joy to come back to again and again, as it seemed to be the most quiet and peaceful of all of them, noticeable as soon as we turned the corner each time. The breakfast was quite nice, running from 7 - 11 am and consisting of a huge variety of wonderful cheeses and breads, meats, tomatoes, hard boiled eggs, cereals, coffee, tea, juices and pastries. There are several rooms to eat in, all adjacent to each other and each cozy and private, including the garden courtyard. When we checked out we still had a full day in Paris before getting on a train that night and the Hotel staff easily and kindly agreed to keep our bags at the hotel all day for us while we continued to enjoy the city. We will most definitely be back and would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but hot”
Reviews.Author: Shajen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in July. Lovely hotel, great staff, small hot rooms, small breakie room which can be very busy. Location made up for everything as it is in the middle of everything. Priced a bit on the high side but it is Paris I'd stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: KKent
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, easy walk to the tower. Local spots to eat were great. Staff all spoke English and were very helpfull. Euro breakfast, no services like big hotels. No restaurant, only 35 rooms, but very quaint, you certainly feel like your in Paris. Book online or get quote online and email for best pricing.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Chambiges Elysees Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SwansonFamily
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Europe. Part of our vacation was spent in Paris where we stayed at this incredible boutique hotel. We had a two room suite to accommodate our two teenagers and it was perfect. The suite was spacious, had great storage and comfortable beds. The daily breakfast bar was a great way to start the day. We loved the atmosphere and you can't beat the hotels location. It's an easy walk to everything. We highly recommend this hotel and thank the staff for an exceptional experience.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful spring break in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Clurdy
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. We booked a superior room and were upgraded to the apartment on arrival - a huge suite of rooms. Reception staff couldn't be more helpful. Good room facilities, carefully serviced each day. View of Eiffel Tower from living room. Breakfast room was a little too small and sometimes difficult to find a space. Buffet well stocked, plenty of choice - really great value. Would recommend Chambiges for location and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located in Prime Shopping Area!”
Reviews.Author: nshafz
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with great location. Short walk to Prada, Louis Vuitton, D&G, Celine and so much more shops. Well decorated room, we took 2 rooms both were comfortable size, knowing Paris, their room not as big compared to American's hotel. Breakfast included was a plus, though breakfast room kind of petite. Wireless also free, just that you need to get excess code from the front desk. They speak good English at this hotel and very helpful too. Also short walk to get a nice view of Eiffel Tower like in the postcard! We used taxi to get around, to Louvre and Galleries La Fayette cost less than Euro 15.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of smoking rooms here.”
Reviews.Author: apandres
Reviews.Content: Despite requesting a non-smoking room, we were given a smoking room that smelled just awful. We attempted to air it our by opening the window, but were forced to shut it at night due to the noise from the street below. It was also stifling hot inside and the thermostat did not seem to work. However, the staff was very friendly and spoke excellent English, and the room would have been nice had it not been hot and smokey. If you decide to stay here - clarify your room before checking in and insist on a room that faces the courtyard rather the the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Maggieburlington
Reviews.Content: A very beautiful, quiet hotel with friendly staff and excellent location! Just around the corner from the effiel tower and the Siene River boat cruises. We enjoyed our stay very much. The staff were very helpful and their english very good, the decor is beautiful and the beds and room very comfortable. It was immaculate! The breakfast was just everything we needed and with great choices. Highly recommend this Hotel. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Gay Paree”
Reviews.Author: govinda1
Reviews.Content: Tiny hotel with tiny rooms and tiny toilets. However this place is so close to the Arc de triomphe and the Champs Elysees that its all worth it. I enjoyed my stay.Very helpful staff - even if you dont speak french.Small but comfortable room, good working breakfast, excellent location

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Fishawk
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel with 2 other couples the first week in May. We found it a wonderful place to stay. The front desk staff spoke excellent english and were very helpful with recommendations for restaurants. The location is quite convenient to the Metro and just off Rue Montaigne, the most stylish street in Paris. This is a great time to visit Paris with comfortable temperatures and the chestnut trees in bloom. It is within walking distance of the Eiffel tower and river bateaux are 2 blocks away. The hotel is on a very quiet side street. The rooms are classic French with all of the amenties you will need including wi-fi. Our room was a little small by U.S. standards, but what we have come to expect in this type of hotel in Europe. We would highly recommend a stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “my first stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: peterpolen
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in this hotel - and I really think I will return to this hotel as soon as possible. The location is great, the street was very quiet and the hotel too. This is a hotel I like in Paris, small (not 500 rooms), quiet, very close to main interesting points and I think that the staff was verry very friendly and helpfull to make my stay as nice as possible. The room was really big and very clean. In the room was a high speed internet acces for free... I like this hotel and I would like to say: thank you to the manager and the whole staff.

Reviews.Title: “The Chambiges Elysees was a disaster”
Reviews.Author: clubclassfirst
Reviews.Content: The Chambiges hotel should not have 4 stars, the staff are arrogant and unhelpful, the rooms and corridors are dark and drap. The rooms are noisy. The breakfast area is ridiculously small and the food is very disappointing. Our family was glad to get out of the place. There are many other hotels in Paris where you will be much more comfortable and at half the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Mold and mildew!”
Reviews.Author: YEOLouisiana
Reviews.Content: The room itself was a nice size for a family of four. It was beautifully furnished. Upon entering, we recognized a musty, mildew smell. We then discovered that the carpet was wet outside of the bathroom area. We immediately brought it to the attention of the front desk and were told it would be taken care of in the morning. The next day, we were out all day, and when we returned, the carpet was still wet. Once again, we went to the front desk and we were told that the problem was fixed and the carpet would be dry in the morning. The next morning, the carpet was still wet. We were assured it would be fixed. When we arrived mid-afternoon, there was a dehumidifier in the room, the bathroom cabinet door was removed (yes, I have photos), and there was the additional smell of a strong chemical. Once again, we complained and we were told we'd be moved to another suite. We packed our things and then, after packing, were told that the hotel was completely booked. So, once again, we had to spend another night in a stinky room with wet carpet. When my husband began to complain to the management, the housekeeper came down and admitted that there were some "roudy kids" who had occupied the room prior to us and had made a mess of it, requiring some repairs. When he heard this, he asked for some type of compensation since another room wasn't available, and there was no offer to move us to another hotel. The management basically told him "tough". There was no discount, no compensation, no anything - just 4 sick people who had endured 3 nights of a mildew-infested room.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ChambigesElysees - Paris - A total deception!”
Reviews.Author: prodigalsun
Reviews.Content: We reserved this hotel based on the, mostly, good reports by Tripadvisor members. However, from our experience, it would seem that some of these members were looking through rose coloured glasses, this could easily be from having been so overwhelemed by the outstanding beauty of Paris, its buildings, statues, avenues, parks etc. Our experience of this hotel started with the elderly man on reception making a very caustic and sarcatsic remark about our surname, when we corrected him he just laughed it off. Even though we had made the booking well in advance and had also, a week before our arrival, checked to see if our reservation was in order, it took them some considrable time to find the folder containing our booking, again, no apology. If you are in any way claustrophobic don't go anywhere near this hotel, you get out of the lift (tiny & very hot) and end up in exceedingly narrow, very dark (no windows anywhere) corridors and are followed around by automatic emergency lights, flicking on and off as you progress, there is hardly room to carry your case along. The room was of a satisfactory size but with very dismal wallpaper and depressing curtains with a lot of dark wood everwhere, again, dingy. Also, if you don't like to by cramped and squeezed up while having your breakfast, don't try here, the tables must have come from a cocktail bar somewhere, there is absolutely nowhere to put your cups and plates. The food selection is most disappointing, and the area where you have to serve yourself just about allows one person in at a time. If the door is left open to the tiny patio area, then the eating area becomes full of smoke from the guests out there. The coffee was poor and not hot. On the TV, if you are English speaking, you can only get BBC World News 24 hours a day. There are many, many satellite programmes for free in English available all over the world. They offer a coffee/tea making facility, however, you are only supplied with one ration of tea/coffee on arrival, if you are staying more than one night you have to keep going down to reception to ask for refills and this proceedure can take time while to porter goes to find it in the kitchens. Do not be mislead by the hotel's hyp that the Champs Elysees is just round the corner, it is NOT nor is the Eiffel Tower, they are a considerable walk away, more deception! When we booked we asked for a quite, non-smoking room as high as possible, we got ... a smoking room, ashtrays everywhere, double bed, 1st, floor right oposite a bar/restaurant which kept us awake every night until 3am., when we complained about this the management of the hotel told us "it has nothing to do with the hotel, it is not our problem", it is their problem, the hotel is situated in a residential zone with a police station right next door, the management should have made an official complaint to the police and had the bar close down at a reasonable hour, A total disrespect for the hotel guests. We found that the majority of the staff had a superiority complex and enjoyed talking down their noses at the guest (especially those who were not French). It is, in our considered opinion, a hotel that is highly overpriced with an owner/management team who are perfectly happy to con their unsuspecting guests. It also does not deserve the 4 stars they display and to that end we are going to write to the French Minister of Tourism, M. HervÃ© Novelli to ask him to have the establishment re-assessed, 3 stars would be more than enough! Perhaps this will force the management in to providing better facilities, staff and honesty. Another annoying and deceiptful trick of the hotel was that, on arrival at CDG airport in Paris, we took a 'taxi parisien' to the hotel (by the way we did not find one taxi driver in Paris who knew or could find the hotel - watch out for high taxi fares while they try to get you there), the cost from airport to hotel was â‚¬34.50, so, a full 24 hours before our departure from the hotel we asked the reception to order a 'taxi parisen' to take us back to the airport. We waited in the lobby and were informed, more or less on time, that the taxi was here, we went out to find a minbus waiting, in good faith we got in but it was only some minutes later we realised it did not have a meter, so when we arrived at the airport we had a demand for double the cost ie. â‚¬70, we tried to get the price reduced but were told that he had a good commission to pay the hotel and that was why the price was so high........... so yet another con trick by the Hotel Chambiges Elysees. We have to admit, we were looking forward to our trip to Paris and staying at this hotel, but, based on our personal experience, we would definitley NOT recommend this hotel, it was a very unpleasant and irritating encounter with such a duplicious organisation.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience”
Reviews.Author: York2007York
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in the hope that it would be a special little gem, with great rooms and great service â€“ unfortunately this was not the case. The hotel itself is very pretty and located among a very exclusive part of Paris and this I think could be the issue. The staff are not very friendly, almost bordering on arrogant (except Dorothee who was lovely). This is not a cheap hotel and you expect a decent level of service but we did not get this. There is nothing major here but at this level of hotel the small details separate the great hotels from the average ones. We were first of all placed in the wrong room. Booked a superior room and put in a standard, I asked to be moved to a room that I had paid for and the challenged that I had actually booked it (although I had booking confirmation!). When they eventually agreed to move us they gave us a room right by the breakfast room so every morning you got woken up by people have breakfast! On our second day we came back from a day out and about (3:30pm) and found our room was not made up, they said they had not got round to it yet â€“ it is only a small hotel!. When we checked out and let them know our concerns they did not seem interested at all â€“ even tried to charge us for items we did not have on the mini bar!! Over this could be a great hotel but the staff let it down, I would recommend you take you money and spend it elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: MaryLeeStenson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for those who want to walk to the Eiffel Tower (15 minutes) and the Arc de Triomphe (15 minutes). Beautiful tree-lined street with upscale fashion stores and quiet neighborhood. We walked to dinner at night and ate outside with views of the Eiffel Tower lit up. Stunning. The staff was pleasant and friendly. Very small, boutique hotel. Breakfast tables were small and close together, but that must be how they do it in France. Nice little French breakfast with croissants, jambon et fromage. We had a suite for our 4 year old daughter and it was very spacious and perfect for our family. We would recommend this hotel and stay there again the next time we go to Paris. Beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to feel like you're a beggar, call this hotel !”
Reviews.Author: MarioAnteksen
Reviews.Content: When you call the hotel, one of these 4 persons answer your call: Bruno, Sandra, Alan, or Andre. If you're reserving a room during rush times in Paris (during an exhibition, sports game, or new year's eve) these people become extremely rude at taking in your inquiry ! I don't need to see the rooms or check out the food when I feel that I need to beg the staff not to put me on hold for more than 10 minutes !!! Try calling them: [--] and ask anything you want. The first thing you'll get is "Please hold, we have to take another call". Why the hell would you pick up if you're going to place clients on hold forever ???!!! BECAREFUL WHEN YOU GET A VERBAL CONFIRMATION FROM THE STAFF !!! DON'T GIVE YOUR CREDIT CARD DETAILS BEFORE YOU GET YOUR AVAILABILITY CONFIRMATION IN WRITING ! And if you think you can talk with the general manager of this hotel, e-mail me and tell me you succeeded. The manager doesn't EXIST ! I challenge him/her to respond to this message and tell me I am mistaken !

Reviews.Title: “A Treasure”
Reviews.Author: dena2882
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this lovely boutique hotel Aug. 31st for several days. The hotel itself is lovely , the beds are very comfortable with a loveseat at the end by the french doors, the decor is very french and well chosen. The staff are very nice , my husband and I liked the new member named Dominic , this young man was always pleasant and prepared to go out of his way to be helpful. The hotel is as it's been written before is close to everything , shopping , restaurants and of course all the main sights. Around the corner is this terrific restaurant named " Chez Andre " The lady that runs the establishment is especially nice and is helpful to non- speaking french customers. There is a restaurant on the right end of the street that I don't recommend, you will always find a long line up of locals waiting to go in to this restaurant I think it was entrocote ---------. We did make it in one evening when there became a lull in the line-up we also discovered that there are NO Menu's everyone is served the same dish ... Steak & Frites with an ugly brownish, green sauce. all you can eat which is obviously the draw to this establishment.. On the other hand if you like this bland menu , get ready to stand in line for a log time.

Reviews.Title: “Chamibiges Elysees was GREAT”
Reviews.Author: missyvelvet2
Reviews.Content: My son, daughter-in-law and myself spent 3 nights at this wonderful hotel. The room was large and had plenty of room for the 3 of us. I can't say enough about how courteous and helpful the entire staff was. Each and every person always greeted us with a bright "Hello" or "Is there anything I can do for you?" The hotel location was great for walking to many points of interest. I would recommend this hotel to anyone interested in a small hotel that was very clean and had a wonderful staff that was more than willing to assistant you.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and super location”
Reviews.Author: reves
Reviews.Content: You won't be disappointed in this hotel. It is a great location, within walking distance of the Champs Elysee. The staff is helpful, the rooms classy, and there is a small bar. Breakfast is very good. The 8th arrondissment is a great place to experience Paris - one can stroll to the Arc de Triumph easily from the hotel. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Andy&Shell
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a 25 minute taxi ride from CDG airport, costing 40 euros. We checked in at 10pm with no issues, the reception clerk was very helpful and suggested places to eat in the late evening. He spoke excellent English despite my attempts to use school boy French. The room was small but beautifully decorated, and felt very Parisian. The bathroom was clean, with all the expected amenities for a short stay. (No probelms with hot water at all, despite having 2 showers and a bath some days!). The bed was comfortable and there was a mini bar with coffee making facilities. TV provided a range of French channels, BBC World and NBC in English. It was quiet, but our view was of the internal courtyard, not great but the location made up for it. The continental breakfast (buffet) included and was adequate, providing the usual mix of ham and cheese, croissants, rolls, fruit, yogurt and fruit juices. On the last day we were late to breakfast and they had run out of croissants. We asked the waiter for more and he went to the shop especially to pick up a fresh batch! The location is what really makes this hotel. On our first night there - it was late and we went for a little stroll to find something to eat. A 5 minute walk around a few corners and we had a magnificent view of The Eiffel Tower at night! This was totally unexpected - we never realised how close to it the hotel was. There was a charming little restaurant on the corner of this street with an amazing view of this great landmark. It was called "Chez Francis". The food here was of good quality and has a real French feel to it - Unlike many of the places on The Champs Elysees which we found to be over priced and very touristy. On the second night we went to a trendier place full of a younger crowd called Libresens. We decided to order cocktails; a black Russian and a Mojhito. The obviously experienced bar man suggested I tried something a little more exciting - he seemed to know what he was doing, so I agreed. He made probably one of the best cocktails I had ever tasted (a Gin MaiThai). My partner decided to stick with his very boozy black Russian. The food here was again good and this place had a really nice vibe about it. It was contemporary and was a welcomed break from Paris' sometimes stuffy and uptight surroundings. Everything was a stones throw away. In the space of 3 days we were able to visit The Eifflel Tower, The Arc de Triomphe, The Louvre, The Pompidou Centre and Montmartre. The Metro is one of the most time efficient ways for getting around and costs peanuts. Our hotel was a sanctuary away from the hustle and bustle of Paris' busy streets. It exceeded our expectations in every way and is excellent value for money. A well priced boutique hotel that we would definitely recommend. (Looks just as it does on the website!)

Reviews.Title: “More than expected...”
Reviews.Author: katsikopodari
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel during the X-Mas period for 4 nights. The hotel is located in a very elegant area with many boutiques near it and the avenue Champs Elysees only 10 minutes on foot. The rooms were spaceful and very clean. There was no problem with the heat and the bathroom had all the necessary equipment for a short stay. The most enjoyable of all was the privacy in the room as no noise existed. We really enjoyed our sleep as the beds were very comfortable. The breakfast was very tasteful and we found fresh products. The X-Mas decoration should have been more satisfied as no decoration existed besides the x-mas tree. The receptionists were very friendly and very helpful, especially the women... I recommned Chambiges Elysees because it is a hotel that provides all the necessary things that a guest expects by a 4 star hotel. The pictures in the site are exactly the same as the hotel is in reality

HotelInfo.Name: Chambiges Elysees Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 8 rue Chambiges | 8th Arr., 75008 Paris, France
